results.title: How to cope with stress = coping with stress
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video Therapy with Alf Fowles”.
Stress is a normal, everyday part of life. People have different stress thresholds and individuals react to identical stressors to different degrees. British therapist, Alf Fowles, editor of the magazine “Natural Medicine”, explains how stress can affect our lives outlining the warning signs of possible mental breakdown and gives ten coping strategies. A simple self hypnosis technique to reduce stress is demonstrated at the conclusion of the program.

results.title: Young and just beginning: Pierre
results.brief_description: Focuses on Pierre Quinn, a young French-Canadian boy from Hauterive, Quebec, as he trains and performs along with other young dancers at the National Ballet School of Canada. When the school began, there were no male students but now of the 147 student one quarter are male. Theis change in attitude toward the male dancer was influenced to a great extent by Nuryev and Baryshnikov.

results.title: Video expeditions collection
results.brief_description: This series of travel documentaries is sure to delight. They engage even the most dedicated armchair traveller on a series of adventures guaranteed to create itchy feet and a desire to pack and head for the nearest travel agent.

results.title: The Thread makers
results.creator_credit: John Chittock, James Archibald and James Archibald and Associates
results.brief_description: Illustrates the nature of J. & B. Coats’ activities as makers and marketeers of thread of all types for every variety of use. Filmed in India, Austria, Spain, England and Scotland with a strong emphasis on the human interest. The development of synthetic thread, requiring new techniques and processes, is shown to be a likely prospect for the future

results.title: The Thirteenth floor
results.brief_description: This film takes a humorous look at all the safety errors committed in a short time in a typical office. It is effective in pointing out the hazards which exist in offices and the accidents which workers can cause - or control.

results.title: Sense and sensibility
results.creator_credit: Rodney Bennett, Barry Letts and BBC
results.brief_description: The story centres around two devoted sisters, Elinor, whose dignity and restraint represents “sense” and Marianne, excitable and impetuous, who represents “sensibility”. Forced by tragic circumstances to set about the delicate task of finding suitable husbands the two sisters suffer a series of disappointments and wonder if they will ever find true love and happiness. A dramatic adaptation of the novel by Jane Austen.

results.title: Video maker
results.creator_credit: Shane Yeend, Scott Young, Nine Network (Australia) and Alliance Productions
results.brief_description: Video maker is designed to help transform the confused home video operator into a budding video director. This tape looks at topics such as focus, handheld and zoom, camera editing, depth of field and exposure as well as looking at terminology, different filming techniques and equipment.

results.title: Senso daughters
results.creator_credit: Noriko Sekiguchi, Institute of Papua New Guinea Studies, Siglo Co and Tenchijin Productions
results.brief_description: Senso means “War”. “Senso daughters” is an account of the experience of Papua New Guinean and Japanese women in the South Pacific during World War II. A unique film in that it critically looks at the effect of the war not only on the indigenous culture but also on the Japanese people. Anti-war sentiment has never been tolerated within Japanese culture. For director, Noriko Sekiguchi, the film is very much a personal statement with a global message. Not only does the film critically question the war-time decisions of the late Emperor Hirohito, but it also makes public for the first time some startling information. The Japanese army took “comfort women” when they were occupying a new territory. The army prostitutes were conscripted from Korean and poor Japanese women and shipped to military bases in Rabaul.

results.title: Wind
results.creator_credit: Ivan Sen, Graeme Isaac, New South Wales Film and Television Office, ABS, SBS Independent and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crossing Tracks Series”.
1857, The Australian Alps. Jess, a young black tracker and his elderly sergeant discover the body of a gold miner. They track the killer, an old Aboriginal man, to a cabin on a clear plateau. After losing their horse and with the sergeant in bad health they are forced to shelter in a cabin. As Jess falls asleep he is visited in his dreams by the old Aboriginal man. When Jess is faced with executing the old man he is forced to decide his fate, to choose his friend the sergeant, or to follow his ancestral soul. Cast includes Ralph Cotterill, Bradley Byqar and Steve Dodd.
